text: Is there a way to turn *global module* into a standard module (meaning that it becomes editable in CMS and not in Design Manager)?
Cloning it, unfortunately makes another global module :confused:

I don't think it's possible right now to edit from the front end.  It was submitted as an idea a few weeks ago if you want to upvote in the hopes it will be taken into consideration

<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Global-Module-Non-Technical-Editing/idi-p/308973>

Hey <@UMVR6LVLK> you should be able to make a local copy of your global module by following along with these directions (<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/cos-general/can-i-make-changes-to-a-global-module-in-only-one-template>). If the module is on a template, just right click the module in the template from the design manager and click on "Make a local copy".
You can make a local copy which will allow you to edit it in that template.

Thank you <@UHJM7AW02>. I did that (several times, for more than one template + I created new page based on such template) -every time it's still locked. Does this functionality even work (I mean, I know it should, but does it really?)

Thank you <@U26AKMZ19>. I did that (several times, for more than one template + I created new page based on such template) -every time it's still locked. Does this functionality even work (I mean, I know it should, but does it really?)
I did that several times and got the notification:
and that's basically all
nothing else changes
Are you seeing any new modules being added in your Design Manager sidebar?
and the module keeps to be locked
The module is going to stay global but it should create a copy of the module that is local in your Design Manager sidebar. Feel free to send me a link and I'd be happy to take a closer look.
ok, found copies
I've got so many files that I haven't noticed
+ I assumed it would change this particular module, not create another file
Thank you, that's exactly what I needed :slightly_smiling_face:
No problem :thumbsup: I ran into the same issue when first doing it (not seeing it in the sidebar) so I'll send that feedback along to our team. Happy that helped!
Any way to increase the crm_object function 10 calls limit? would be great if it were 20 or 30 max instead of 10.
No, but you can use `crm_objects` to get objects in batches.
Thanks Jeff. that was my fallback idea however that would require us to add the contacts email and name to the deal.
Gmail will strip a bunch of stuff but I hear than they're working on being able to add emails as attachments (might even be released!) so this might help.
